# About
Dr. Kendra M. Wu is an engineer turned theoretical epidemiologist. She is currently a Postdoctoral Researcher in Statistical/ Mathematical Modelling of Infectious Diseases at the [Centre for Tropical Medicine and Global Health](https://www.tropicalmedicine.ox.ac.uk) of [Nuffield Department of Clinical Medicine](https://www.ndm.ox.ac.uk), [University of Oxford](http://www.ox.ac.uk), where she uses mathematical and statsistical analyses to study infectious disease outbreaks in low and middle income countries (LMICs). Recently, her focus has been on Ebola Virus Disease (EVD).

# Research Interests
* Infectious disease epidemiology and control
* Outbreak analysis and response
* Emerging infections
* Disease transmission dynamics
* Mathematical modelling
* Evolution of pathogens
* Global health
